info.title: Craft Studio Manager API
info.description: API for Craft Studio Manager including authentication and app builder functionality

StudioCookieAuth.name: X-Studio-Cookie
StudioCookieAuth.description: Base64-encoded encrypted cookie for Google AI Studio

tags.name: Requirements
tags.description: Requirement management, tracking, and code analysis

tags.name: Projects & Organizations
tags.description: Managing companies, organizations, and user projects

tags.name: Database Management
tags.description: Generic database administration and CRUD endpoints

get.description: Returns the status of the API
Validates the auth token parameter via query parameter

post.description: Validates the auth token parameter via request body

post.summary: Decrypt auth token and save user data to database
post.description: Decrypts the provided auth token and saves the user data to the D1 database

post.summary: Add or update webhook in GitHub repository
post.description: Adds a webhook to the specified GitHub repository. If the webhook already exists, it updates the webhook to match current specifications. The webhook URL is https://services.nonprod.svchub.com/git_webhooks/github_cloner with content type application/json, SSL verification enabled, webhook secret from WEBHOOK_SECRET environment variable, and sends all events.

message.example: GitHub credentials are invalid. Please update your credentials.
GitHub repository not found. Please ensure the repository exists.

get.description: Retrieves the saved GitHub username (token is never returned)

message.example: Credentials not found for this user.

post.description: Saves or updates GitHub username and personal access token
Checks if a repository exists using stored GitHub credentials

message.example: GitHub credentials are invalid. Please update your credentials.
No GitHub credentials found. Please save your credentials first.

get.description: Checks if a repository exists in HumanizeIQ Gitea

post.summary: Add or update webhook in Gitea repository
post.description: Adds a webhook to the specified Gitea repository. If the webhook already exists, it updates the webhook to match current specifications. The webhook URL is https://services.nonprod.svchub.com/git_webhooks/gitea with content type application/json, triggers on push and pull request closed events for all branches, and includes Bearer system-key authorization header.

message.example: Gitea repository not found. Please ensure the repository exists.

get.summary: Get open pull requests from Gitea
get.description: Retrieves all open pull requests for a component's Gitea repository

parameters.name: componentId
parameters.description: Component ID to fetch pull requests for

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid componentId

message.example: Authentication required. Please provide valid credentials.
An unexpected error occurred while fetching pull requests. Please try again.

get.description: Gets the status of a specific pull request by ID, including merge status, state, conflict status, and branch information.

hasConflicts.description: True when mergeable is false, indicating merge conflicts

message.example: Pull request not found. Please check the PR ID and app name.

post.summary: Merge and close Gitea pull request
post.description: Initiates an asynchronous merge of a pull request in Gitea using merge commit strategy with force merge enabled. Returns immediately with status 202. Automatically creates route entries: playtestdev creates dev route in ROUTES_DB (services.nonprod.svchub.com/{app_name}), devmain creates prod route in ROUTES_DB_PROD (services.prod.svchub.com/{app_name}). Use the PR status endpoint to check merge completion.

message.example: Pull request #1 merge initiated. Use the PR status endpoint to check merge status.
Pull request not found. Please check the PR ID and app name.
Cannot merge PR: PR is not mergeable
Pull request has already been merged.

post.description: Triggers a redeploy of an app on a specific branch by calling {GITEA_WEBHOOK_BASE_URL}/redeploy with Authorization Bearer token and X-GitHub-Event header (base URL configurable via GITEA_WEBHOOK_BASE_URL, auth token via GITEA_WEBHOOK_AUTH_TOKEN)

appName.description: Name of the app to redeploy

branch.description: Branch to deploy (main, dev, or playtest)

message.example: Redeploy triggered successfully for gais_my_app on branch main
Redeploy service error: 500 - Internal Server Error

post.description: Triggers a force deploy workflow for an app via webhook service. This bypasses normal deployment checks and forces a deployment for a specific PR.

message.example: Force deploy workflow triggered successfully for gais_my_app
Force deploy webhook endpoint not found

post.summary: Enable branch protection rules for an app
post.description: Enables branch protection rules for main and dev branches in a Gitea repository. This disables direct pushes and only allows merge commits via pull requests.

componentId.description: Optional. Component ID to resolve the repository from. Use this for existing components.

appName.description: Optional if componentId is provided. Name of the app/repository used to construct the gais_ prefix.

message.example: Branch protection rules processed for my-app

post.description: Creates a defect issue in the Gitea repository for an app with optional file attachments. Attachments are uploaded first, then linked in the issue body.

description.example: When clicking the login button, nothing happens. Expected behavior: should redirect to dashboard.

data.description: Base64 encoded file content (with or without data URI prefix)

message.example: Access forbidden. Please check token permissions.
Repository not found. Please ensure the repository exists.

post.description: Creates a new repository in HumanizeIQ Gitea instance with three branches: main, dev, and playtest. Repository names must be unique - returns 409 if a repository with the same name already exists.

message.example: Repository 'gais_my_app' created successfully with branches: main, dev, playtest.

409.description: App name already exists or repository already exists

message.example: A repository with this name already exists. Missing branches have been created.

post.description: Creates a new route entry in the routes database for playtest, nonprod, or prod environments. If a route already exists for the app, it updates the existing route. All URLs are configurable via BASE_URL and WORKER_DOMAIN environment variables.

environment.description: Environment to create route for (playtest, nonprod, or prod)

message.example: Route for 'my-app' in nonprod environment updated successfully.
Route for 'my-app' in playtest environment created successfully.
Invalid environment. Must be one of: playtest, nonprod, prod
Organization ID and name are required.
Organization with this name already exists

get.description: Retrieve all projects, optionally filtered by organization

409.description: Conflict - project already exists in organization

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid data

get.description: Retrieve all companies in the CMS
Retrieve a specific company by its slug
Retrieve all projects for a specific company
Retrieve a specific project by its slug
Retrieve all components for a specific project (metadata only, no fields)
Retrieve a specific component with its fields and content

fields.description: Array of field definitions with values

value.description: Field value (type depends on field type)

get.description: Retrieve component definition based on the component ID

get.summary: Get component by GitHub repo name
get.description: Retrieve component definition based on the GitHub repository name (hiq_repo)

message.example: Component not found with the specified repo name.

get.summary: Get component by GitHub repo name
get.description: Retrieve component definition based on the GitHub repository name (github_repo field)

message.example: Component not found with the specified GitHub repo name.

get.description: Retrieve all components for a specific project

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid projectId

post.description: Create a new component within a specific project

400.description: Bad request - missing required fields or invalid type

message.example: Project ID, name, title, and type are required.

409.description: Conflict - component with same name already exists

message.example: Component with this name already exists in this project

patch.description: Update an existing component within a specific project. All fields except id are optional.

400.description: Bad request - missing component ID or invalid type

message.example: Component with this name already exists in this project

post.summary: Invite a collaborator to a component repository
post.description: Invite the authenticated user as a collaborator on the component's GitHub repository using the repository owner's credentials

400.description: Bad request - missing configuration or credentials

message.example: Component does not have a GitHub repository configured

post.description: Archives the specified component by setting is_archived to 1.

get.description: Retrieve all requirements for a specific component

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid componentId

message.example: componentId query parameter is required and must be a valid number.

post.description: Create new or update existing requirements for a component

id.description: Optional - include for updates, omit for new requirements

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

reference_hash.description: Optional - unique_hash of a parent requirement to link this defect to via task_hash_table

message.example: Each requirement must have type, title, and status.

get.description: Retrieve a specific requirement using its unique hash identifier (SHA-256 hash of componentId-appCode-requirementId)

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Unique hash identifier for the requirement

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

post.summary: Backfill unique hashes for existing requirements
post.description: Generates and updates unique_hash for all requirements that don't have it populated. This is useful for migrating existing data after adding the unique_hash feature.

post.summary: Assign a requirement to a user
post.description: Creates a task linked to the requirement and assigns it to the specified user (or the authenticated user if user_id is not provided). The requirement's assignee field is also updated.

user_id.description: Optional - User ID (UID) to assign to. If omitted, assigns to authenticated user.

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

message.description: Could be "requirement_id is required." or "requirement_id must be a valid number."
Could be "Requirement not found.", "Assigned user not found.", or "Component not found."

get.description: Retrieve a specific requirement by its numerical ID with full details.

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

patch.description: Update individual fields of a requirement. Only the fields provided in the request body will be updated.

schema.description: At least one field must be provided

description.example: As a user, I want to login...

message.example: No valid fields provided for update. Allowed fields: type, title, description, status

delete.description: Permanently delete a requirement by its ID.

post.description: Posts a message to the build-queue to trigger a build for the specified unique hash.

unique_hash.description: The unique hash for the build

message.example: An unexpected error occurred while triggering build.

get.summary: Get all child requirements for a parent requirement
get.description: Retrieve a list of all child requirements linked to a specific parent requirement.

post.description: Create a new child requirement (SubRequirement, Enhancement, Defect) linked to a parent requirement.
Create new or update existing child requirements linked to a parent requirement.

requirements.description: Array of child requirements to save

patch.description: Update fields (type, title, description, status, assignee, sequence) of an existing child requirement.
Update only the status of a specific child requirement.

post.description: Archives the specified requirement by setting is_archived to 1.
Archives the specified child requirement (sub-task) by setting is_archived to 1.

message.example: Valid child requirement ID is required.

get.description: Retrieve requirements by analyzing code from a GitHub repository

parameters.name: hiq_repo
parameters.description: Gitea repository name in owner/repo format (e.g., HumanizeIQ/gais_myapp)

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Folder path in the repository (optional, defaults to root)

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: Name of the file to fetch (optional, defaults to requirements.md)

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid hiq_repo

message.example: Failed to fetch file from repository.

post.summary: Create a pull request in Gitea
post.description: Creates a pull request from playtest to dev or dev to main in the component's Gitea repository

targetBranch.description: Target branch for the pull request (dev or main). Source branch is automatically determined: playtestdev or devmain

comment.description: Optional comment/description for the pull request

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid parameters

404.description: Component, repository, or branch not found

409.description: Pull request already exists or branches are identical

message.example: Pull request already exists or branches are identical.

get.description: Retrieve all system-level prompts, configuration from the server
Retrieves all prompts associated with a specific component

parameters.name: componentId
parameters.description: Component ID (optional - if not provided, all prompts are returned)

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid componentId

post.description: Creates a new prompt for a component

400.description: Bad request - missing or invalid data
Bad request - missing or invalid data
Bad request - missing or invalid id

get.description: Retrieves all component prompts from the database

message.example: Failed to fetch all component prompts

get.description: Retrieves chronological history of all archived versions for a specific prompt

post.description: Sends an email using the Resend email service. Supports multiple recipients, CC, BCC, attachments, and a flexible content structure for extensibility.

content.description: Flexible content object for email body and attachments

body.description: Dynamic JSON array for email body content

example.text: Thank you for joining our platform.

email_id.description: Unique identifier for the sent email

400.description: Bad Request - Missing required fields or invalid data

value.message: receiver_email must be a non-empty array.
Invalid attachment: filename, content, and type are required for each attachment.

message.example: Authentication required. Please provide valid credentials.
Email payload exceeds maximum allowed size.

502.description: Bad Gateway - Failed to send email via Resend

message.example: Failed to send email via Resend service.

post.summary: Create a reference link between items
post.description: Creates a reference link in task_hash_table to associate two items (e.g., linking a defect to its parent requirement) without using foreign keys.

unique_hash.description: The unique identifier of the child item being linked (e.g., the Defect hash)

reference_hash.description: The unique identifier of the parent/reference item (e.g., the Requirement hash)

message.example: unique_hash is required and must be a non-empty string.

get.summary: Get tasks for the authenticated user
get.description: Retrieve all tasks assigned to or created by the authenticated user

status.description: Task status. "Blocked" is a virtual status that sets the blocked flag.

post.description: Create a new task. The assignedDate is automatically set to the current timestamp.

assignee.description: User ID (uid) of the person assigned to this task

message.example: title is required and must be a non-empty string.

patch.description: Update the status of a task. Backend automatically sets startDate when status changes to InProgress and closeDate when status changes to Closed.

status.description: New task status. Setting to "Blocked" requires additional_info. Setting to "ReAssign" requires "assignee".

assignee.description: New assignee UID. Required when status is "ReAssign".

message.example: status is required and must be one of: To Do, Blocked, In QA, Open, In Progress, Closed, Done

patch.description: Enable the assignee to edit only the description and task title.

dueDate.description: New due date for the task (ISO 8601 format)

message.example: title is required and must be a non-empty string.

403.description: Unauthorized - user is not the assignee

message.example: Unauthorized: Only the assignee can edit this task

patch.summary: Update task weight for vertical ordering
patch.description: Update the weight value of a task to control its vertical position within its status column. Tasks with higher weight values appear at the top.

weight.description: New weight value for vertical ordering. Higher values appear at the top.

message.example: weight is required and must be a valid number.

delete.description: Allows a user to delete a specific task using its unique task ID. Deletion is blocked if the task is associated with a requirement.

400.description: Bad request - Task associated with a requirement

message.example: Task is associated with a requirement and cannot be deleted directly. Please delete the requirement instead.

post.description: Archive a specific task by its ID. Archived tasks are hidden from default views.

get.summary: Get task and requirement details by hash
get.description: Retrieve full task details and its associated requirement details (if any) using a unique hash code.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: Unique hash code for the task

200.description: Task and requirement details retrieved successfully

message.example: Task not found for the provided hash.
Failed to fetch task by hash

post.description: Creates a new billing record in the database. user_id and company are derived from authenticated user if not provided.

user_id.description: Optional: User ID (defaults to logged-in user)

company.description: Optional: Company name (defaults to logged-in user's company)

reference_id.description: Optional: Reference ID for the transaction

post.description: Endpoint to receive and log billing callbacks.
Executes a raw SQL query against the AI Studio Manager database.

sql.description: The raw SQL query string to execute

params.description: Optional parameters for the SQL query

get.description: Returns the schema of the database including tables and columns.
Returns Prisma-compatible metadata for the database.
Returns the contents of the schema.prisma file.

patch.description: Syncs the database schema with the latest version from the Git repository.

post.description: Generates a SQL migration script from a given Prisma schema.

get.description: Fetches all records for a given model and converts them to a CSV file.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The name of the database model to export

get.description: Fetches all records for a given model and converts them to a Parquet binary file using parquetjs-lite.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The name of the database model to export

404.description: Model result not found or empty

get.description: Returns a paginated list of records for the specified model.

post.description: Creates a new record for the specified model.

get.description: Returns a single record by its ID.

patch.description: Updates an existing record by its ID.

delete.description: Deletes a record by its ID.
